meanings.definition: To crush or squeeze something so that it becomes flat or broken.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally smushed my sandwich in my bag.
meanings.sent2: She smushed the clay into a pancake shape.
meanings.sent3: The cat smushed itself into the tiny box for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The heavy book smushed the delicate flower beneath it.
meanings.sent5: The child smushed the playdough into various shapes with glee.

meanings.definition: To press something together so that it is no longer in its original shape.
meanings.sent1: He smushed the playdough between his hands.
meanings.sent2: The hiker accidentally smushed the berries in her backpack.
meanings.sent3: The clown smushed his nose to make a funny face.
meanings.sent4: The car accident smushed the front bumper against the wall.
meanings.sent5: She smushed the paper into a ball and threw it in the trash.

meanings.definition: To combine or mix different things together.
meanings.sent1: She smushed the colors together to create a new shade.
meanings.sent2: The chef smushed the ingredients to make a delicious sauce.
meanings.sent3: The siblings smushed their toys into one big pile.
meanings.sent4: The artist smushed various textures to form a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent5: He smushed the fruits to make a refreshing smoothie.
